intro: Clavenna tetrandra, commonly known as the four-threaded clavenna, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Clavenna tetrandra is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
